statement.p: To find the distance across a river, a surveyor choose points A and B, which are 220 m apart on one side of the river. She then chooses a reference point C on the opposite side of the river and finds that \displaystyle\angle{B}{A}{C}\approx{84}^\circ and \displaystyle\angle{A}{B}{C}\approx{58}^\circ.
